channel.title: Universal Health Care
channel.description:
Should the United States consider approving Universal Health Care?
Me Personally- No

Not to mention USA is the only country taxed on their global income.

USA is being utterly gay atm.

We have to pay $4.00 per gallon when it used to be $1.50 before the war.

^And thats at lowest [not even premium just regular shit]

Were gunna end up like africa xD
[/quote]

Just so you know, that is a cheaper than a lot of other countries. At the moment we are paying just a little bit more though.[/quote]

In Cairo, a liter of petrol is about 22 cents.

EDIT: We have it in England, but the waiting times are pathetic. When I broke my arm when I was like 8, we were up in A&E for a good couple of hours(3-5).

item.title: Universal Health Care
item.dc:creator: @afi afi
item.description:
@afi wrote:

[quote=“Tico135, post:14, topic:202344”]Like jme said, in Canada, health care is free, and is paid for through taxes. If you have the money to pay for these taxes then yes, it’s great. Otherwise, it’s really not. I personally think that the US should look into Universal health care, as people would not be spending thousands of dollars in hospitals bills.

It’s a big controversy, some people believe they should, and others believe they shouldn’t.[/quote]

We shouldn’t.
We have Medicaid and Medicare.
Most of it is going to become bankrupt in twenty years. Why?
Because people are taking more out of it then we are putting in.

Read full topic

Like jme said, in Canada, health care is free, and is paid for through taxes. If you have the money to pay for these taxes then yes, it’s great. Otherwise, it’s really not. I personally think that the US should look into Universal health care, as people would not be spending thousands of dollars in hospitals bills.

It’s a big controversy, some people believe they should, and others believe they shouldn’t.

jme - in the usa rich people get taxed enough. my family is not rich but i feel sorry for rich people. they usually work hard to make their money and the goverment taxes them out of their ass.

item.title: Universal Health Care
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

We have it in Canada, and it’s good sometimes. Example, my grandma’s appendix ruptured and caused quite a bit of damage. She was in florida for the winter, and the surgery was going to be $700,000. So instead, they flew her back to Canada in a helicopter (which was free) and they did the surgery. She was in the hospital for nearly 2 weeks and when she was all better, she walked out without having to pay a penny. Similar story for me as well, except I was already in Canada and was released in 3 days lol.

Yeah we get taxed to fuck, but jobs also pay a lot more. I think the vast majority of people here would not want to lose their universal healthcare.

The other problem is waiting times. If it’s not a true emergency, you can expect to wait a while. Sometimes for minor things such as an eye injury (someone slap shotted a hockey puck at me) I had to wait like 3 hours. Other times were like ~40 minutes. To see a specialist, I have to wait half a year just to get surgery on my knee. It’s starting to drive me insane too, though I am enjoying my prescribed vicodin in the mean time One of the main causes of these waiting times are old fuckers who go everytime they have the sniffles or a sore finger from picking their arse too much.

Canada has a low population though. I think in a country like USA, it simply would not work. It would just get too bogged down and people are definitely not patient enough for it there.

Read full topic
